definition[0]: a large sea animal that eats fish and lives around coasts
definition[1]: a mark that has a special design and shows the legal or official authority of a person or organization
example[0]: The document carried the seal of the governorâ€™s office.
definition[2]: the object that is used to make this mark
definition[3]: a piece of rubber or plastic that keeps air, water, dirt etc out of something
example[1]: an airtight seal around the windows
definition[4]: a piece of wax, paper, wire etc that you have to break in order to open a container, document etc
definition[5]: to close an entrance or a container with something that stops air, water etc from coming in or out of it
example[3]: Dried milk is kept in hermetically sealed  (=very tightly closed) containers.
example[4]: A quick way to seal awkward gaps is to use a foam filler.
definition[6]: if a building, area, or country is sealed, no one can enter or leave it
example[5]: Authorities plan to seal the border.
definition[7]: to close an envelope, package etc by using something sticky to hold its edges in place
example[6]: He wrote the address and sealed the envelope.
definition[8]: to cover the surface of something with something that will protect it
example[7]: Wooden decks should be sealed to prevent cracking.
definition[9]: to do something that makes a deal, agreement etc formal and definite
